00031 namespace MC2Map {

00033    class AllocatorException : public std::exception {
00034    public:
00035       explicit AllocatorException( const MC2String& str) throw():
00036             m_str( "Allocator: " + str ) { }
00037       virtual ~AllocatorException() throw() { }
00038       const char* what() const throw() { return m_str.c_str(); }
00039    private:
00040       MC2String m_str;
00041    };
00042 
00048    class AllocatorPool {
00049    public:
00050       AllocatorPool( uint32 blockSize ) 
00051             : m_referenceCount( 1 ), m_blockSize( blockSize ),
00052               m_blockPos( 0 )
00053       {
00054          m_memBlocks.push_back( new byte[ m_blockSize ] );
00055       }
00056 
00057       ~AllocatorPool() {
00058          STLUtility::deleteArrayValues( m_memBlocks );
00059       }
00060 
00061       void* allocate( size_t n ) {
00062          // If bigger than blocksize, make own block for this allocation
00063          if ( n > m_blockSize/2 ) {
00064             // Note pushed front not to change current block
00065             m_memBlocks.push_front( new byte[ n ] );
00066             return m_memBlocks.front();
00067          } else {
00068             // Check current block
00069             if ( m_blockPos + n > m_blockSize ) {
00070                // Full new block needed
00071                m_memBlocks.push_back( new byte[ m_blockSize ] );   
00072                m_blockPos = 0;
00073             }
00074             m_blockPos += n;
00075             
00076             return m_memBlocks.back() + m_blockPos - n;
00077          }
00078       }
00079 
00080       void addUser() { ++m_referenceCount; }
00081 
00082       bool removeUser() { 
00083          --m_referenceCount;
00084          return  m_referenceCount == 0;
00085       }
00086    
00087    private:
00089       list< byte* > m_memBlocks;
00090 
00092       uint32 m_referenceCount;
00093 
00095       uint32 m_blockSize;
00096 
00098       uint32 m_blockPos;
00099    };
00100 
00101 
00105    template <class T> class Allocator;
00106 
00107    // specialize for void:
00108    template <> class Allocator<void> {
00109    public:
00110       typedef void*       pointer;
00111       typedef const void* const_pointer;
00112       // reference to void members are impossible.
00113       typedef void value_type;
00114       template <class U> struct rebind { typedef Allocator<U>
00115                                          other; };
00116    };
00117 
00121    template <class T> class Allocator : public allocator<T> {
00122    public:
00123       typedef size_t    size_type;
00124       typedef ptrdiff_t difference_type;
00125       typedef T*        pointer;
00126       typedef const T*  const_pointer;
00127       typedef T&        reference;
00128       typedef const T&  const_reference;
00129       typedef T         value_type;
00130       template <class U> struct rebind { typedef Allocator<U>
00131                                          other; };
00132 
00133       Allocator( uint32 blockSize = MAX_UINT16 ) throw() {
00134          m_pool = new AllocatorPool( blockSize );
00135       }
00136 
00137       Allocator( const Allocator& o ) throw() {
00138          m_pool = o.m_pool;
00139          m_pool->addUser();
00140       }
00141 
00142       template <class U> Allocator( const Allocator<U>& o ) throw() {
00143          m_pool = o.m_pool;
00144          m_pool->addUser();
00145       }
00146 
00147       ~Allocator() throw() {
00148          if ( m_pool->removeUser() ) {
00149             delete m_pool;
00150          } // Else still used by other allocator
00151       }
00152 
00153       pointer address( reference x ) const {
00154          return &x;
00155       }
00156 
00157       const_pointer address( const_reference x ) const {
00158          return &x;
00159       }
00160 
00161       pointer allocate( size_type size,
00162                         Allocator<void>::const_pointer hint = 0 ) {
00163          return static_cast<pointer>( m_pool->allocate( size * sizeof( T ) ) );
00164       }
00165 
00166       void deallocate( pointer p, size_type n ) {
00167          // Done, see destructor
00168       }
00169 
00170       size_type max_size() const throw() {
00171          return size_type( -1 ) / sizeof( value_type );
00172       }
00173 
00174       void construct( pointer p, const T& val ) {
00175          //new ( static_cast<void*> ( p ) ) T( val );
00176          new( p ) T( val ); // initialize *p by val
00177       }
00178 
00179       void destroy( pointer p ) {
00180          // Leaks? no leaks here.
00181          // // Destroy *p but don't deallocate
00182       }
00183 
00185       AllocatorPool* m_pool;
00186 
00187    private:
00189       Allocator& operator=( const Allocator& o ) {
00190          if ( &o != this ) {
00191             m_pool = o.m_pool;
00192             m_pool->addUser();
00193          }
00194          return *this;
00195       }
00196 
00197       template <class U> Allocator& operator=( const Allocator<U>& o ) {
00198          if ( &o != this ) {
00199             m_pool = o.m_pool;
00200             m_pool->addUser();
00201          }
00202          return *this;
00203       }
00204    };
00205 
00206 } // namespace MC2Map
